Submodules¶

pricingengine.dataset module¶

class pricingengine.dataset.DataSet(data, schema, index_colnames)¶

Bases: object

The DataSet class combines un-schematized data with a schema that specifies column meta-data

__init__(data, schema, index_colnames)¶

Initializes a new instance of the DataSet class.

The given data-schema pair needs to adhere to the following expectations:

  • Each column defined in the given schema must be contained in the corresponding given data
  • Each column must have a data type corresponding to its schema DataType as follows:
    • DataType.NUMERIC: integer or floating-point
    • DataType.DATE_TIME: datetime
    • DataType.CATEGORICAL: string or integer
  • The dataset owns the indexing for its dataframe (existing row indexes on the dataframe will be removed)
  • The dataset does not mutate the input data (it makes its own copy)
Parameters:
  • data – The time series data to be used for computing effects
  • schema – The schema specifying the meta-data for the time series
  • index_colnames – A list of column names to be used to construct panels from the given data
data¶

The time series data underlying this dataset. :return:

fit_encoders(enc_dict)¶

Fits the encoders in a dictionary generated by gen_encoders()

gen_encoders()¶

Returns a dictionary colname:encoder for all CATEGORICAL cols plus the time col

get_all_cols_by_coltype(col_type)¶

Return all columns fron the dataset with the specified id

get_col_by_coltype(col_type)¶

Return the column fron the dataset with the specified id

get_col_by_name(col_name)¶

Return the column fron the dataset with the specified name

num_cols¶

The number of columns in the underlying data

num_rows¶

The number of rows in the underlying data

schema¶

The user-defined schema for this dataset

pricingengine.schema module¶

class pricingengine.schema.ColDef(col_name, data_type, col_type=None)¶

Bases: object

Class used to define name and type of each column of data. Will typically reside in a Schema object

__init__(col_name, data_type, col_type=None)¶
Parameters:
  • col_name (str) – Name of the column
  • data_type (DataType) – Type of the column
  • col_tag (ColType) – Additional meta data specifying the feature category of the column
col_name¶

The name of this column

Returns:The name of this column
Return type:str
col_type¶

The type for this column

Returns:The id for this column
Return type:ColType
data_type¶

The datatype of this column

Returns:The type of this column
Return type:DataType
class pricingengine.schema.DataType¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Machine-learning category of column type (i.e., to handle cases where a column of ints may actually represent categorical data)

CATEGORICAL = 3¶
DATE_TIME = 4¶
NUMERIC = 2¶
static is_supported_dtype(data_type, dtype)¶

Determine if the specifed data type is supported for the given DataType

Parameters:
  • data_type (DataType) – The type of the column
  • dtype (dtype) – The underlying data type of values contained in the column
static verify_is_supported_dtype(data_type, dtype)¶

Check if dtype is supported for data_type

class pricingengine.schema.Schema(col_defs, time_colname=None, panel_colnames=None)¶

Bases: object

Specifies the column information for a corresponding data set

The schema must adhere to the following expectations:

  • Each column id can be applied to only a single column
  • Each column name can only be applied to a single column
__init__(col_defs, time_colname=None, panel_colnames=None)¶

Created a new instance of a Schema

Parameters:
  • col_defs (list) – A list of column ColDef objects specifying the columns in a time series
  • time_colname (str) – Col name that corresponds to the time variable
  • panel_col_names (list) – Column names which divide the data into time series, or None if the data contains only a single time series.
get_col_defs()¶

Get the list of column definitions

Returns:A list of the column definitions for this schema
get_col_names()¶

Get a list of the names of all columns specified in the schema

Returns:A list of column names
get_col_types()¶

Get a list of all the ColTypes defined in the schema

Returns:A list of the ColTypes defined in the schmea
